required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Safety Tolerability and Antiviral Activity of ACH-0143102 Plus RBV Treatment Naive HCV GT1b Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1b, Open-label, Pilot Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Antiviral Activity of Oral ACH-0143102 Administered in Combination With Ribavirin for 12 Weeks in Treatment Naive Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus Infection Genotype 1b.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: ACH-0143102 plus ribavirin will lower viral load in hepatitis C genotype 1b treatment naive subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: A phase 1b, pilot study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and antiviral activity of oral ACH-0143102 administered in combination with ribavirin for 12 weeks in treatment naive subjects with chronic hepatitis C virus infection genotype 1b.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: To determine the incidence of a sustained virologic response at 12 weeks after the completion of dosing (SVR12) with ACH-0143102 plus ribavirin, reported as HCV RNA less than the limit of quantification (<LOQ) at that time point

secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events, ECG, Vital Signs, Physical Exams and clinical laboratory evaluations.

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine complete early virologic response(cEVR)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the incidence of a complete early virologic response (cEVR), defined as HCV RNA reported as undetectable at Week 12, for combination therapy of ACH-0143102 plus RBV for 12 weeks in subjects with HVC infection genotype 1b.

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the incidence of a rapid virologic response(RVR)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the incidence of a rapid virologic response (RVR), defined as HCV RNA<limit of quantification(LOQ) at Week 4, for combination therapy of ACH-0143102 plus RBV in subjects with HCV infection genotype 1b.

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the incidence of an extended rapid virologic response(eRVR)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the incidence of an extended rapid virologic response(eRVR), defined as HCV RNA reported as undetectable at Weeks 4 and 12, for subjects treated with combination therapy of ACH-0143102 plus RBV in subjects infected with hepatitis C virus genotype 1b.

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the incidence of a sustained virologic response
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the incidence of a sustained virologic response at 4,8, and 24 weeks after the completion of dosing(SVR4,SVR12,and SVR24) with ACH-0143102 plus ribavirin, reported as HCV RNA less than the limit of quantification(<LOQ) at those time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic relationship of ACH-0143102 and RBV treatment and virologic response

arm_group.description: ACH-0143102 225 mg loading dose on Day 1 followed by 75 mg maintenance dose for 12 weeks plus RBV either 1000mg if weight <75 kg or 1200 mg if weight > 75 kg.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of Hepatitis C with genotype 1b
- Chronic hepatitis C treatment naive subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI>36
- pregnant or nursing females
- clinically significant laboratory abnormalities at screening
- previous participation in a clinical trial with protease inhibitor and/or NS5A inhibitor
- HIV infection or other liver diseases
- Positive Hepatitis B Surface Antigen
- Liver cirrhosis
- uncontrolled psychiatric disease
- clinical evidence of chronic cardiac disease
- history of malignancy of any organ system within 5 years
